The gold comes from three different ores with the following compositions:
0.209 kg Au: 6.8 ppm Au and 1.5 ppm Ag in ore	
0.1538 kg Au: 5.4 ppm Au and 0.15 ppm Ag in ore	
0.7561 kg Au: 0.97 ppm Au and 0.76 ppm Ag in ore	

The input amount of 0.1538 kg of gold was calculated based on the recovered gold for this mine and the recovery rate of the two other mines (not known for this mine).
The other two input amounts were calculated based on the gold concentration in the ore and the amount of ore extracted.

The silver comes from three different ores with the following compositions:
0.5924 kg Ag: 0.76 ppm Ag and 0.97 ppm Au in ore	
0.0043 kg Ag: 0.15 ppm Ag and 5.4 ppm Au in ore	
0.0469 kg Ag: 1.5 ppm Ag and 6.8 ppm Au in ore	

The input amount of 0.5924 kg of silver was calculated based on the silver concentration in ore and amount of ore extracted.
The other two amounts were calculated based on the recovered silver for this mine and the recovery rate of another mine (recovery rate known for only one of the mine and supposed equivalent for all three mines).
Calculated Value based on weighted average from 3 mines.

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
comment:
The exchange has been updated from 'ammonium nitrate, as N' into 'ammonium nitrate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.002 kg by 2.8573 kg of 'ammonium nitrate' per kg of 'ammonium nitrate, as N'. Original comment of the exchange is: Estimation based on ''iron mine operation and iron ore benefication to 65% Fe, Québec 2011'' dataset (based on the extracted ore). 
Assumption : use of explosive Anfo.

Used as a dispersant.

comment:

It was assume a 60% ethylene glycol solution (% by volume), as its freezing point is -55 C (dilution water is neglected as it is marginal compared to the global amount of water consumed on site) (source :  http://www.engineeringtoolbox.com/ethylene-glycol-d_146.html).

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
comment:
Calculated value based on nickel, 99.5% dataset (ecoinvent v2).
ecoinvent v2 dataset:
extracted mineral: 110t
sand required: 45,6t
sand required per extracted mineral: 416kg/t

extracted mineral in Quebec mine:1279778 t
total required sand: 416*1279778=532387648kg

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
input_name: market for sulfidic tailings, from nickel mine operation
comment:
Calculated Value based on the Environmental Impact Assessment and a conversion factor (ore mined in 2010/expected amount of ore according to ElA).  
The sulfidic tailings, off-site dataset is used as a proxy, composition of leachage to water may not fully correspond. For the modelled mine, sulfidic tailings remain on site. The landuse in the tailing dataset is much smaller than the one of the modelled mine. Landuse is hence directly added in this mine operation dataset.

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
comment:
Measured Value. National Pollutant Release Inventory (NPRI), 2010. This is Canada's legislated, publicly accessible inventory of pollutant releases (to air, water and land), disposals and transfers for recycling.
http://www.ec.gc.ca/inrp-npri/

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
comment:
Calculated Value. National Pollutant Release Inventory (NPRI), 2010. This is Canada's legislated, publicly accessible inventory of pollutant releases (to air, water and land), disposals and transfers for recycling.
http://www.ec.gc.ca/inrp-npri/
Dinitrogen monoxide emissions from diesel burning processes were substracted from the value measured on site.

In dataset ''sulfidic tailing, off-site'' only emissions via bottom leaching are considered. Hence, emissions to water contained in the final effluent are added.
